JobFullDesc: In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a Data Center Operations Analyst.Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I DC OPS Analyst, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Microsoft Azure platform, Bing, Office 365, Xbox and OneDrive. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development for all employees and offers trainings and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.Do you want to empower billions across the world? Come and join us in CO+I and be at the forefront of the action!#COICareers #Buildthecloud #ChangetheWorld #WeSeeYou #RepresentationMattersResponsibilitiesAs a successful Data Center Operations Analyst, your success will be measured by:· Learning and living the One Microsoft culture and values. Lead through change by bringing clarity, generating energy, and delivering success.· Develop and implement analytical models that establish an improved data-driven understanding of our Datacenter Operations worldwide, drive continuous improvements, and make informed staffing decisions.· Analyze and interpret data to provide recommendations and insights into datacenter-related staffing models and capacity drivers.· Collaborate and engage with subject matter experts to gain operational insight into building analytical models leveraging real-life experiences.· Use standard and ad-hoc reporting methods to gather and consolidate pertinent data to run resource modeling experiments.· Maintain and enhance internal staffing data warehouse infrastructure leveraged by Workforce Strategy & Planning team.· Participate in technical communities to stay informed of best practices and changes within the broader discipline and share them with the organization.As a successful Data Center Operations Analyst, your day-to-day work will include:· Utilize critical thinking skills to conceptualize complex business problems and develop solutions using advanced analytics on large scale, real-world business data.· Independently execute analytics projects, communicate findings to internal teams and translate them into action to benefit Datacenter Operations.· Define business problem, propose hypothesis, procure data, and develop models to identify improvement opportunities.· Apply advanced statistical techniques, time series analysis and forecasting models to analyze structured and unstructured data to improve Staffing forecasts.· Visualize analytic results in a form that is consumable by a diverse set of stakeholders.· Apply structured thinking to provide clarity to complex business problems and execute by collaborating and working through others (teammates, SMEs, and leadership teams) and influence without authority.· Communicate effectively and concisely with stakeholders and leaders about our programs and objectives.QualificationsMicrosoft reviews all applications that meet the below Required Qualifications. For this role, you are welcome to apply if you
